RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisabl e to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOLOSHOT coaxed from the gate, established the front from the get go and showed the way in hand along the inside, cut the corner roused into upper stretch, went clear under a drive to the eighth pole, continued to widen away geared down inside the final sixteenth to the finish and prevailed comfortably on the wire. FAST AND FRISKY coaxed from the start, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing nearing the quarter pole, swung four wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on to secure the place honors. GIOIA MIA chased just off the inside under a ride from the five-sixteenths, swung two to three wide into upper stretch, kept on to preserve the show honors. DUSK stumbled at the start conceding three lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch before tipping out a path straightened away and improved position. LOVE THYSELF chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened. KHALI'S STORM coaxed from the gate, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, went five to six wide into upper stretch and tired. JINGLE JANGLE stumbled at the start but broke near the top despite it, chased along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and tired. ARCHIVIST bobbled at the start and came under hustling conceding two lengths to the front, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Dusk
ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Barber, Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Archivist
ENTRY.OWNER: Grant Joseph M Marsh Greg A Can Do Racing LLC Walsh Steven M and Chichakly Amira
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, hustled, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Khali's Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 2p 5/16, 5-6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Jingle Jangle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased ins, coaxed near 1/4, ins 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Gioia Mia
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2-3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Soloshot
ENTRY.OWNER: Bregman Family Racing LLC Jackpot Farm and Swinbank Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, cut corner roused, went clear

ENTRY.NAME: Love Thyself
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Fast and Frisky
ENTRY.OWNER: NY Final Furlong Racing Stable SunsetRidge Racing Stable and Sportsmen Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, 4w upper, no match, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Fleet Indian S. SARATOGA RACE 2 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 84. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. This is a Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each which should accomp any the nomination; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplement payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 123 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstake at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 3 lbs.; of a sweepstake or two races other than maiden, claiming or starter at a mile or over allowed 5 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, August 12, 2023 with 8 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICHIBAN broke out significantly but came away in front, was coaxed into the first turn, raced in the three path on that bend, prompted the pace on the outside, vied in the two to three path on the far turn, took the lead just inside the five-sixteenths, moved clear coming to the quarter-pole, was put to a right-handed crop in upper stretch, switched to a left-handed crop just inside the furlong marker and drew away under steady urging. AMANDA'S FOLLY broke out and bumped with a rival then came outward while trying to be corrected by the rider, moved from the rail to the two path on the first turn, tugged on the bit passing the seven-eighths pole, was rated inside of a rival, tracked the leaders in the two path on the far turn, was asked while shifting four wide approaching the quarter-pole, was put to a left-handed crop into upper stretch, drifted out outside the furlong marker then was straightened by the rider and was second best. TIMELY CONQUEST broke awkwardly then made light contact with a foe, took the lead in the two path on the first turn, showed the way on the inside of the winner, vied inside to the two path on the far turn, was asked under threat near the three-eighths, lost the advantage just inside the five-sixteenths, dropped back into the stretch and capitulated. KRYSTALHEIR broke in and bumped with a foe then was taken up some while pinched back, went two then three wide on the first turn, tugged hard on the bit under tight restraint onto the backstretch, was rated outside in the second flight, came up empty before going five furlongs and faltered then was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda's Folly
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,came out,ins-2p1st,rated,2p2nd,4p1/4,2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Krystalheir
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bmpd,squeezed back,2-3p1st,pulld,outside,falter,eased,wlkd

ENTRY.NAME: Timely Conquest
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward brk,light contact,2p1st,pace ins foe,ins-2p2nd,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ichiban
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,in front,3p1st,prompt out,2-3p2nd,lead out1/4,drew away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Point S. Presented by Trustco Bank SARATOGA RACE 3 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 105. Stakes Purse 200000. INNER TURF A HANDICAP FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each whic h should accompany the nomination; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the public ation of weights. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. High weights preferred. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New Y ork Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the Main Track. Closed Saturday, August 12, 2023 with 17 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CITY MAN coaxed from the gate, settled tracking the front just off the inside until tucked inside with seven-sixteenths to go, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three then four wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge inside the final eighth taking command seventy yards from the finish, then edged away to the finish to prevail. SPIRIT OF ST LOUIS just off the inside through the first turn, prompted the pace four then three wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole swung three wide into upper stretch, took over command with three-sixteenths to go, dug in under threat and was collared seventy yards from home, ran on to safely preserve the place honors. JERRY THE NIPPER showed the way in hand along the inside, came under coaxing in the two path at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, yielded the front with three-sixteenths to go and weakened in the late stages. DAKOTA GOLD grew fractious in the gate leaping up and was allowed to settle before the start, tracked the pace along the inside and then just off the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, continued in the two path into upper stretch and had no kick. OCALA DREAM two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing three to four wide at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Dakota Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, tracked ins, coaxed 2p near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: City Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing Searles Peter and Searles Patty
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, tracked 2p, to ins 7/16, 3-4w uppr, up fin 70yds, clr

ENTRY.NAME: Ocala Dream
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael Bouchey Steven and America's Pastime Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3-4w 3/8, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Jerry the Nipper
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, coaxed 2p 5/16, 2w 1/4p, yielded 3/16, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Spirit of St Louis
ENTRY.OWNER: Madaket Stables LLC Dubb Michael and Schermerhorn Richard
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p 1st turn, prompted 4-3w, 3w upper, up 3/16, caught fin 70yds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Funny Cide S. Presented by Rood and Riddle Equine Hospital SARATOGA RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divid ed 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than claiming allowed 2 lbs.; maidens allowed 4 lbs. A presentation will be ma de to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, August 12, 2023 with 11 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE WINE STEWARD stumbled twice at the start then was bumped by a rival, settled on the outside, chased in the four to five path on the turn, pursued the leader under a left-handed crop in upper stretch, switched to a right-handed crop approaching the furlong marker, drifted in significantly while making a bid shortly thereafter, dropped all the way alongside the runner-up, dueled gamely with that foe to the finish and narrowly prevailed under strong handling. EL GRANDE O stumbled at the start but regained his footing quickly, moved up while hustled to get the lead, vied inside to the two path on the turn, was asked inside the five-sixteenths, spun into the stretch in the two path, came under a right-handed crop near the three-sixteenths, switched to a left-handed crop while dueling inside of the winner outside the sixteenth-pole, fought gamely to the finish and just missed while clear for the place. WHATCHATALKINABOUT was taken back between foes under tight restraint then reserved at the back, went three wide while roused on the turn, shifted five wide at the quarter-pole, remained on his left-lead in the stretch, drifted in badly outside the sixteenth-pole and safely secured the show. WORKS FOR ME unseated the rider behind the gate, lost his footing at the start but broke with the field, chased the pace, made a bid in the two to three path on the turn, dropped back in upper stretch and tired. ALWAYS A WARRIOR was away alertly then coaxed along in a good position, raced inside to the two path while asked for more on the turn and came up empty. TRUST FUND broke out and brushed the gate then bumped with a foe, was coaxed along just off the pace, chased in the three to four path on the turn, dropped back in upper stretch and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: El Grande O
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled brk,regain footing quick,mvd up,pace,ins-2p,dueled,game

ENTRY.NAME: Always a Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly,coaxed along,well placed,ins-2path turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Works for Me
ENTRY.OWNER: KatieRich Stables LLC Connors Christopher G and Appel Lawrence J
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious,lost footing brk,chased pace,bid 2-3path turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Whatchatalkinabout
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back btwn,reservd,3w trn,5w1/4,drift in outside 1/16,clr3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Trust Fund
ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Repole Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,brushed gate,bmpd,coaxed,chsd 3-4path turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: The Wine Steward
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Staudacher David
ENTRY.COMMENT: stmbld 2x's brk,bmp,out,chsd4-5p trn,bid3/16,drft in,dueld,gamely

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Sequel Thoroughbreds LLC, Lakland Farm& Mark Toothaker

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Yaddo H. SARATOGA RACE 5 1 1/16M Turf CR: 94. Stakes Purse 200000. A HANDICAP FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 ea ch which should accompany the nomination; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplement payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the p ublication of weights. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New York Racing Associati on reserves the right to transfer this race to the Main Track. Closed Saturday, August 12, 2023 with 13 Nominations. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEW GINYA settled just off the inside at the tail of the field, remained patiently handled until placed to coaxing near the quarter pole, angled out six to seven wide into upper stretch placed to urging and surged directly to the front at the three-sixteenths coming in three paths, then got ridden out to the finish clear to the end. SPUNGIE got checked along the inside seven furlongs from home when RUNAWAY RUMOUR tucked directly in front as WHATLOVELOOKSLIKE tipped in from the outside, tracked just off the inside until tucked inside through the far turn, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on clear of the rest to secure the place honors. RUNAWAY RUMOUR tracked just off the inside early on, tucked briefly inside seven furlongs from home as rivals tucked in front outside her and forced SPUNGIE to be checked out along the hedge, tipped back to chase just off the inside down the backstretch and through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the finish. WHATLOVELOOKSLIKE broke in at the start bumping LISA'S VISION in tandem with GOLDEN ROCKET, raced four wide into the first turn, quickly tucked three then two wide forcing RUNAWAY RUMOUR to the hedge which in turn forced SPUNGIE to check out to avoid being squished, tracked just off the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths when taking narrow command, swung three wide into upper stretch, got overhauled with three-sixteenths to run and weakened to the finish. CLASSIC COLORS just off the inside through the first turn, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went six wide into upper stretch and weakened. GOLDEN ROCKET broke out at the start bumping LISA'S VISION in concert with WHATLOVELOOKSLIKE, raced three wide through the first turn and then chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung six wide into upper stretch and tired. LISA'S VISION got bumped between foes at the start who each broke her way, raced three then two wide through the first turn, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch and tired. SHE'S DANCING got away to an awkward start and came under coaxing to establish the front shortly after the break, showed the way in hand along the inside coming under coaxing three furlongs out when under pressure from the initial time, yielded the front with five-sixteenths remaining and cut the corner into upper stretch, then tired through to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Spungie
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked ins 7/8, tracked 2p, ins far turn, 3w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: New Ginya
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p at rear, angled 7w upper, surged to front 3/16, lug in, clear

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Colors
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael and America's Pastime Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p 1st turn, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: She's Dancing
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, in hand ins, coax 3/8, yield 5/16, cut corner, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Runaway Rumour
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, to ins 7/8, coaxed 2p 5/16, 5w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 3w 1st turn, chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Lisa's Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped betw st, 3-2w 1st turn, chased 3w, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Whatlovelookslike
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, 4w into 1st turn, tracked 2p, 3w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 84. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROCKET AND ROLL hit the inside of the gate then bumped lightly with a foe while off slow, spotted the front a few lengths, tugged hard on the bit while rated under stout restraint, went three wide for most of the turn, shifted four wide while asked outside the quarter-pole, rallied to make a bid outside the furlong marker, fought outside of two foes to the finish and narrowly prevailed under strong urging. PURE FIRE set the joint pace on the outside, vied in the three path on the turn, was put to a drive in upper stretch, battled between rivals in the final furlong, swapped back to his inside lead at the sixteenth-pole, fought on to the finish and just missed while narrowly getting the place. CLEVER FOREVER was well placed just off the pace, moved up to make a bid nearing the half-mile pole, vied inside on the turn, was given his cue outside the quarter-pole, came under the crop at the top of the stretch, fought inside of the top two in the final furlong and just missed while clear for the show. BEARY FUNNY was hustled from the gate then settled off the pace, went around most of the turn in the two path then was asked while shifting three wide, pursued the leaders in upper stretch, moved out in the final furlong and weakened. NOBILIS settled at the rear, was roused while moving from four to six wide on the turn and failed to respond. REFUAH broke out then was hustled, settled on the outside, was asked while four then five wide on the turn, chased into the stretch and came up empty. FLYING IN STYLE was fractious in the gate, made mild contact with a foe at the start, set a joint pace, vied between foes in the two path on the turn, was asked near the five-sixteenths dropped back into upper stretch and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Beary Funny
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable and St Elias Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,settled,2-3path turn,mvd out final 1/8,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Clever Forever
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,inside bid 1/2,rail turn,ask5/16,fought ins duo,missd

ENTRY.NAME: Nobilis
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,roused 4-6wide turn,failed to respond

ENTRY.NAME: Flying in Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,light bump brk,pace,2p btwn turn,faded

ENTRY.NAME: Rocket and Roll
ENTRY.OWNER: Spendthrift Farm LLC and Frank Fletcher Racing Operations Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate,light bmp,off slw,ratd,pulled,3-4w turn,rally,fought duo

ENTRY.NAME: Pure Fire
ENTRY.OWNER: Talla Racing and West Point Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside pace,3path turn,fought btwn last1/8,inside lead1/16,missd

ENTRY.NAME: Refuah
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Walder Peter R
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,hustled,settled outside,ask 4-5w turn,chased,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Seeking the Ante S. SARATOGA RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 86. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 which should accompany the nominatio n; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be di vided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than claiming allowed 2 lbs.; maidens allowed 4 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, August 12, 2023 with 13 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CALDWELL LUVS GOLD settled just off the inside at the tail of the field, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, tipped out three then four wide through the turn, swung four wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge a furlong out, seized command at the sixteenth pole and inched away gamely at the end. STELLAMARIS four wide in pursuit, advanced nearing the quarter pole taking over command and was set down spinning three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive under threat to the outside, got caught a sixteenth from home, fought on inside that rival while along well clear of the rest and second best. MY SHEA D LADY chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch, improved position to secure the show honors. TRICKY TEMPER coaxed from the gate, vied briefly between foes from the three path before pressing the pace of CARA'S TIME from the outside three then two wide through the turn, took over the front at the five-sixteenths, got displaced by STELLAMARIS near the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, then weakened in the drive. CARA'S TIME hustled from the gate, vied briefly inside a pair from the two path, tucked inside through the turn under pressure from the aforementioned foe to the outside, yielded the front with five-sixteenths to go, took the inside route into upper stretch and folded. CONCERTI coaxed from the gate, vied briefly from the three path outside a pair, then chased three wide through the turn under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, went five wide into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Caldwell Luvs Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p at rear, coaxed 7/16, 3-4w 3/8, 4w upper, up 1/16, game

ENTRY.NAME: My Shea D Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 5/16, angled 3-4w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Cara's Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, vie briefly 2p, ins turn, yield 5/16, ins 1/4, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Tricky Temper
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, vied briefly, pressed 3-2w, up 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Concerti
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, vied briefly, chased 3w, 5w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Stellamaris
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, advanced near 1/4, set down 3w uppr, caught, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 92. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 1 25 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BORN DANCER broke out and bumped with a foe, moved in while going to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked on the far turn, came under the crop while inside of SONIC SPEED in upper stretch, got the best of that foe into the final sixteenth and just held under strong urging. BE OF COURAGE was last to commence, saved ground at the rear, tagged onto the back of the field late on the first turn, was reserved towards the rear, raced inside on the far turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, steadied in traffic near the three-sixteenths pole, moved in while roused shortly thereafter the accelerated between horses, rallied in the final furlong and closed fast inside the winner to just miss while narrowly able to get the place. ONE HEADLIGHT was bumped at the start, moved in early, was reserved in the two path, swung six wide into the stretch then drifted out under a left-handed crop, switched to a right-handed crop in the vicinity of the furlong marker, drifted in around the sixteenth-pole and finished with good energy to just miss while able to get the show. SONIC SPEED went around the first turn in the two path, was rated towards the front, moved closer near the nine-sixteenths, was asked in the three path on the far turn, made a bid at the quarter-pole, battled outside of the winner into the final sixteenth and missed the trifecta. WHISTLER'S HONOR saved ground on the first turn, was reserved off the hedge, raced in the two path while let out on the far turn then was roused, came three wide into the stretch and finished willingly to just miss the superfecta while behind foes late. AMERICAN GRANT went three then four wide on the first turn, was reserved on the outside, traveled three wide while let out on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch, moved out under a drive near the furlong marker and failed to threaten. NOBLE HUNTSMAN rounded the first turn in the two path, was reserved near the back, saved ground on the far turn, turned into the stretch in the two path and was no factor. SHARED SUCCESS tucked into the three path on the first turn, was reserved on the outside, came under urging in the three path on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. GEM MINT TEN was a bit reluctant to load, tracked the pace on the outside in the two path, was given his cue on the final turn and came up empty. FACTUALLY CORRECT showed speed inside of the winner then became keen when taken under restraint nearing the first turn, was rated under snug restraint on the inside, came under some urging near the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into the stretch, was taken in hand while dropping back at the furlong marker and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: Whistler's Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins1st,reserved,let out 2p2nd,3w1/4,willingly,missed super

ENTRY.NAME: Be of Courage
ENTRY.OWNER: Goodman, Gerald and Pregman, Jr., John S.
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,reserved ins,2p1/4,stdy traffic3/16,mvd in1/8,rallied

ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,rated,ask3p2nd,bid1/4,fought with winner,missed

ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w1st,reserved,let out7/16,3w2nd,4w1/4,mvd out1/8,no threat

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,reserved 2path,swung 6w1/4,drift out,drft in1/16,gaining

ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club and Cutair Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit reluctant to load,tracked outside 2p,ask2nd turn,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 9 5 1/2F Turf CR: 84. Allowance Purse 95000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KERRY four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong from home, inched away under a drive kept to task. SIKUM chased three then two wide, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, tipped three to four wide at the three-sixteenths, kicked on with good energy to chase the winner home while securing the place honors. LINARITE chased just off the inside down the backstretch before tucking inside through the turn, cut the corner into upper stretch in behind WEEKEND RAGS, tipped out to the four path just outside the eighth pole following the aforementioned pair and kicked on belatedly to procure the show honors. U SHOULD B DANCING broke out at the start trading a bump with SARATOGA GAZE, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, angled six wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid to secure the last major share. SARATOGA GAZE prompted the pace early on along the inside before chasing along the hedge through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. WEEKEND RAGS coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside down the backstretch before tucking inside through the turn, cut the corner into upper stretch and was in behind a rival paused unable to tip out, got clearance nearing the sixteenth pole and angled in to the hedge roused, then failed to quicken staying one paced to the finish. QUEENS OVER THREES three wide in aim of the front, advanced at the half mile pole to engage BUSTIN BULLET in head to head combat through the turn coming under coaxing on near even terms five-sixteenths from home, swung four wide into upper stretch, got overthrown in tandem with a pair near the eighth pole and weakened in the late stages. DANSEUR D'ORO coaxed from the gate, bobbled three wide at the five furlong marker, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung six wide into upper stretch and offered no response. LITTLE LINZEE chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung five wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. RANTING coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing five-sixteenths from home, went five wide into upper stretch, weakened in the stretch. BUSTIN BULLET crossed to show the way from the two path under pressure from SARATOGA GAZE to the inside, then tucked inside when shaking that rival off and was confronted by QUEENS OVER THREES, dueled through the turn under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and weakened. THREE UNIONS coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, faded, went four wide into upper stretch and gave way, then got eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Weekend Rags
ENTRY.OWNER: NY Final Furlong Racing Stable and WLIR Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, cut corner, beh foes to near 1/16, one pace

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2p, coaxed near 1/4, angled 6w uppr, mild bid

ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted early, chased ins, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, wknd late

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, set down 2w 1/4p, tip 3-4w 3/16, good energy

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, inside turn, cut corner, tip 4w 1/8p, belatedly

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, bobbled 5/8, chased 3-2w, 6w upper, no response

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, angled 6w upper, up 1/8, inched away

ENTRY.COMMENT: led early 2p, dueled ins turn, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w in aim, advanced 1/2, dueled 2p turn, 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, faded, 4w upper, eased

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Albany S. SARATOGA RACE 10 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 250000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $250 each which should accompany the nomination ; $1,250 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,250 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,250 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be div ided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of $55,000 at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake or two races at a mileo r over other than maiden, claiming or starter allowed 4 lbs.; of a race at a mile or over other than maiden, claiming or starter in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, August 12, 2023 with 12 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DRAKE'S PASSAGE bobbled at the start, raced in the three path on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, moved closer to the leader in the three path on the far turn, was roused outside the quarter-pole, took over into upper stretch, drew away under a drive into the final forty yards then was eased up while much the best. JACKSON HEIGHTS broke a bit slow, saved ground on the first turn, lagged at the rear, was urged while moving from the rail to the three path on the far turn, came six wide into the stretch and was along for the place. MIRACLE MIKE was moving around when the gate opened then lunged and was off slow, raced in the two path on the first turn, settled towards the rear, was urged three then four wide on the far turn, came six wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response while best of the rest. MAKER'S CANDY was taken in hand early, went three wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused near the seven-sixteenths, traveled four wide under urging on the final turn, dropped to the two path coming to the quarter-pole then the rail in upper stretch and came up empty. MARIACHI was coaxed to the front, showed the way in the two path with a clear advantage, was asked under threat late on that bend, lost the advantage to the winner while in the three path into upper stretch and tired. ALLURE OF MONEY was hustled from the gate, saved ground on the first turn, was urged along off the pace, dropped back while two path to the inside on the far turn and failed to respond. LEO AND ROYAL was taken under strong restraint while off heels nearing the first turn, continued off heels while inside on that bend then checked when rank, settled more kindly on the backstretch, went three wide on the far turn and had nothing left.

ENTRY.NAME: Leo and Royal
ENTRY.OWNER: Allread Neal M and Langlais Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken in hand off heels,rank,checked rail 7-1/2,3w2nd,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 11 1M Dirt CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SAIL WITH THE WIND got bumped at the start by SHELLY, who broke inwards, chased four then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took over command and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, drew clear under a drive kept to task. SHELLY broke in at the start bumping the aforementioned foe, chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued three wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on to secure the place honors. NORTH END LADY chased along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, kept on to secure the show honors. FOXY CARA four to five wide early on, advanced on the front to take command near the five furlong marker, showed the way and tucked inside into the far turn getting placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths when under threat to the outside, yielded command near the quarter pole and took the inside route into upper stretch, then weakened in the drive. BOSTON STRONG MAMA bobbled at the break, showed the way in hand just off the inside, had the aforementioned foe advance and was headed for the front near the five furlong marker, got placed to a protective hold nine-sixteenths from home and backed away, then got eased home through to the finish and walked off under her own power. LADY LAOBAN chased four to five wide, got given a nudge into the far turn, was stacked four wide outside rivals when placed to a protective hold and then got eased home through to the finish and walked off under her own power.

ENTRY.NAME: Boston Strong Mama
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobble st, in hand 2p, headed 5/8, protected 9/16, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: North End Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 5/16, angled 4w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Sail With the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 4-2w, coaxed 5/16, up 2w 1/4p, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Shelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, no match, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Laoban
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4-5w, protected 5/16, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Foxy Cara
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w early, up 5/8, to ins 1/2, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4, weakened
